alert.note: Alert for Jay (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 11:27AM EDT until March 26 at 9:05PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Salamonie River at Portland affecting Jay County. Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Kosciusko, Marshall, Starke, Pulaski and Fulton IN Counties. .Recent rainfall has resulted in rising water on area rivers. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salamonie River at Portland. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Lowland agricultural flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Saturday was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to gradually fall from its current crest of 12.0 feet. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
